meanings.definition: A Polish coin worth one-hundredth of a zloty.
meanings.sent1: In Poland, you can buy candy with a grosz.
meanings.sent2: He found a grosz on the street and picked it up.
meanings.sent3: The grosz rolled away like a tiny shiny wheel.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as rare as a grosz in a haystack.
meanings.sent5: The grosz gleamed in the sunlight, catching his eye.

meanings.definition: A small amount or sum of money.
meanings.sent1: She only had a grosz left in her pocket.
meanings.sent2: He saved every grosz to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent3: The price was so low, it cost just a grosz.
meanings.sent4: His generosity was worth more than a grosz.
meanings.sent5: The grosz jingled in his hand, a symbol of his hard work.
